comments: This class was incredibly interesting and I\'m glad it was mandatory or I never would have had the chance to take it! It was only as interesting as it was because of his teaching style and openness to debate/conversation among the class. I recommend taking him for this class because he makes you question your preconceived ideas about culture.

comments: This was my least-looked-forward-to class, and turned out to be my best class all semester! He doesn\'t as much lecture as elicits your opinions and leads the discussion of the chapter. I learned a lot, and I do think it made me a more open-minded person. The night class audience definitely helps the experience, too.

tag_professor: Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: I had Dr. Ballew, he is the most amazing professor I\'ve ever had!! I would recommend him to anyone who is willing to put in the time and effort, and participate in discussions. He is a VERY dedicated instructor. Don\'t hesitate to ask if you aren\'t clear on something. As I said, he is very helpful! Oh, he drives a motorcycle on occasion.

tag_professor: Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Best professor I\'ve ever had. His cultural anthropology class is very interesting and his lectures are excellent and very clear. Tests are not hard and as long as you read and do the writing, you\'ll get an A. He respects your opinions and is pretty funny. Take his class if you can, it will change your life.

comments: if you keep up with your anthrophiles you will have no trouble getting like at least a B. and if you listen a little in class you\'ll be fine but class time is suuuper boring if youre not engaging in the discussions. Overall, not too bad of a class!

comments: having close to 50 students, he does remember people\'s name. very clear, but can get boring. forces people to talk but it does help pass the time. his work is very easy and the subject is very interesting to me. gave him an above average but not perfect score because there always room for improvement.

tag_professor: Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Great professor, 1 of the few @ FCC with a PhD. Genuinely cares about all his students, AND is respectful of those with different views. Though the class met only once a week, he learned EVERYONEs names and never forgot. If you\'re interested in the subject, take him. Otherwise you may not find the weekly chapter readings and write-ups worthwhile.

tag_professor: Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: I love this guy; his lectures might be hard for some people to sit through, but he will cut you a break if you really need one. He is funny, takes our abuse, and learns EVERYONES name. I never bought the text book, but I showed up and paid attention.

tag_professor: Inspirational (2)  Amazing lectures (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Caring (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  Respected (1)  SO MANY PAPERS (1)  Participation matters (1)
comments: Mr. Ballew is an anthropologist and is very passionate about his work. He is very down to Earth and has a great sense of humor. His tests are easy if you study, he reviews for the exam in class. Homework is ridiculously simple and easy points. It was an awesome class I learned a lot, highly recommend.
